text: {| class=wikitable align=right width=540 |- align=center valign=top |120px 5-orthoplex |120px Cantellated 5-orthoplex |120px Bicantellated 5-cube |120px Cantellated 5-cube |- align=center valign=top |120px 5-cube |120px Cantitruncated 5-orthoplex |120px Bicantitruncated 5-cube |120px Cantitruncated 5-cube |- !colspan=4|Orthogonal projections in B5 Coxeter plane |} In five- dimensional geometry, a cantellated 5-orthoplex is a convex uniform 5-polytope, being a cantellation of the regular 5-orthoplex. There are 6 cantellation for the 5-orthoplex, including truncations. Some of them are more easily constructed from the dual 5-cube. == Cantellated 5-orthoplex== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3 align=center colspan=3|Cantellated 5-orthoplex |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type |colspan=2|Uniform 5-polytope |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Schläfli symbol |colspan=2| rr{3,3,3,4} rr{3,3,31,1} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Coxeter-Dynkin diagram |colspan=2| |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|4-faces |82 |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells |640 |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces |1520 |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edges |1200 |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertices |240 |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure |colspan=2|40px |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Coxeter group |colspan=2| B5 [4,3,3,3] D5 [32,1,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties |colspan=2|convex |} === Alternate names === * Cantellated 5-orthoplex * Bicantellated 5-demicube * Small rhombated triacontiditeron (Acronym: sart) (Jonathan Bowers)Klitizing, (x3o3x3o4o - sart) === Coordinates === The vertices of the can be made in 5-space, as permutations and sign combinations of: : (0,0,1,1,2) === Images === The cantellated 5-orthoplex is constructed by a cantellation operation applied to the 5-orthoplex. == Cantitruncated 5-orthoplex == {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cantitruncated 5-orthoplex |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||uniform 5-polytope |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Schläfli symbol|| tr{3,3,3,4} tr{3,31,1} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Coxeter-Dynkin diagrams|| |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|4-faces||82 |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||640 |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||1520 |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edges||1440 |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertices||480 |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||40px |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Coxeter groups||B5, [3,3,3,4] D5, [32,1,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||convex |} === Alternate names=== * Cantitruncated pentacross * Cantitruncated triacontiditeron (Acronym: gart) (Jonathan Bowers)Klitizing, (x3x3x3o4o - gart) === Coordinates === Cartesian coordinates for the vertices of a cantitruncated 5-orthoplex, centered at the origin, are all sign and coordinate permutations of : (±3,±2,±1,0,0) === Images === == Related polytopes == These polytopes are from a set of 31 uniform 5-polytopes generated from the regular 5-cube or 5-orthoplex. == Notes== == References == * H.S.M. Coxeter: ** H.S.M. Coxeter, Regular Polytopes, 3rd Edition, Dover New York, 1973 ** Kaleidoscopes: Selected Writings of H.S.M. Coxeter, edited by F. Arthur Sherk, Peter McMullen, Anthony C. Thompson, Asia Ivic Weiss, Wiley-Interscience Publication, 1995, *** (Paper 22) H.S.M. Coxeter, Regular and Semi Regular Polytopes I, [Math. Zeit. 46 (1940) 380-407, MR 2,10] *** (Paper 23) H.S.M. Coxeter, Regular and Semi- Regular Polytopes II, [Math. Zeit. 188 (1985) 559-591] *** (Paper 24) H.S.M. Coxeter, Regular and Semi-Regular Polytopes III, [Math. Zeit. 200 (1988) 3-45] * Norman Johnson Uniform Polytopes, Manuscript (1991) ** N.W. Johnson: The Theory of Uniform Polytopes and Honeycombs, Ph.D. * x3o3x3o4o - sart, x3x3x3o4o - gart == External links == * * Polytopes of Various Dimensions, Jonathan Bowers * Multi-dimensional Glossary Category:5-polytopes
title: Cantellated 5-orthoplexes
